meanings.definition: To die through submersion in and inhalation of water.
meanings.sent1: The poor man drowns in the deep river.
meanings.sent2: She drowns in the pool because she cannot swim.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy duck drowns in the bathtub while trying to swim.
meanings.sent4: His sorrow drowns him in a sea of tears.
meanings.sent5: The shipwreck survivor vividly remembers how the storm almost drowns him at sea.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm with a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The loud music drowns out all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent2: The delicious aroma of the bakery drowns the street.
meanings.sent3: The colorful decorations drown the room in a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter drowns the silence of the library.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city at night drown the sky with their glow.

meanings.definition: To deprive of air by submersion in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman accidentally drowns the bait in the water.
meanings.sent2: The chef drowns the vegetables in the sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy drowns its toy in the water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The artist drowns the canvas in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The gardener drowns the plants with too much water, causing them to wilt.
